name: physics_quantum_physics
description: A comprehensive collection of classical and quantum physics formulas including mechanics, thermodynamics, electromagnetism, optics, fluid mechanics, quantum phenomena, and 2024-2025 breakthroughs.

I. Mechanics.name: Gravitational Force (Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation)
Potential Energy (Gravitational)
I. Mechanics.description: Energy due to height in a gravitational field.

I. Mechanics.name: Conservation of Mechanical Energy
I. Mechanics.description: Total energy in a conservative system is constant.

I. Mechanics.name: Impulse
I. Mechanics.description: Change in momentum due to force applied over time.
I. Mechanics.formula: J = Delta p = F * Delta t

I. Mechanics.name: Work-Energy Theorem
I. Mechanics.description: Work done equals change in kinetic energy.

I. Mechanics.name: Centripetal Force
I. Mechanics.description: Force keeping an object in circular motion.

II. Thermodynamics.name: First Law of Thermodynamics
II. Thermodynamics.description: Conservation of energy; heat added to a system increases internal energy or does work.

II. Thermodynamics.name: Ideal Gas Law
II. Thermodynamics.description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature.

II. Thermodynamics.name: Efficiency of a Heat Engine (Carnot Efficiency)
II. Thermodynamics.description: Maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine.

III. Electromagnetism.name: Electric Field (Point Charge)
III. Electromagnetism.description: Field strength due to a point charge.

III. Electromagnetism.name: Magnetic Force on a Moving Charge (Lorentz Force)
III. Electromagnetism.description: Force on a charge moving in a magnetic field.

III. Electromagnetism.name: Ohm's Law
III. Electromagnetism.description: Relationship between voltage, current, and resistance.

III. Electromagnetism.name: Faraday's Law of Induction
III. Electromagnetism.description: Induced electromotive force (EMF) due to changing magnetic flux.

IV. Optics.name: Snell's Law
IV. Optics.description: Refraction of light at an interface.

parameters.R1, R2: Radii of curvature of lens surfaces

V. Fluid Mechanics.name: Bernoulli's Equation
V. Fluid Mechanics.description: Conservation of energy in fluid flow.
V. Fluid Mechanics.formula: P + (1/2) * rho * v^2 + rho * g * h = constant

V. Fluid Mechanics.name: Pascal's Law
V. Fluid Mechanics.description: Pressure applied to a fluid is transmitted equally.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Complementarity Principle (Bohr)
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Mutually exclusive classical concepts are complementary in quantum descriptions.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Schrödinger Equation (Time-Dependent)
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Governs time evolution of quantum systems.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Schrödinger Equation (Time-Independent)
VI. Quantum Physics.description: For stationary states with definite energy.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Probability Density (Born's Rule)
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Interprets wave function squared as probability.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Path Integral Formulation (Feynman)
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Sum over histories approach to quantum mechanics.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Particle in a Box (1D)
formulas: psi_n(x) = sqrt(2/L) * sin(n * pi * x / L)

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Angular Momentum Commutation
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Fundamental relations for angular momentum operators.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Pauli Exclusion Principle
VI. Quantum Physics.description: No two fermions can occupy identical quantum states.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Quantum Fourier Transform
VI. Quantum Physics.formula: QFT |x> = (1/√N) Σ_y e^{2πi x y / N} |y>

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Higgs Mechanism
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Mass generation via spontaneous symmetry breaking.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Hubbard Model
VI. Quantum Physics.formula: H = -t Σ_{<ij>σ} (c_{iσ}†c_{jσ} + h.c.) + U Σ_i n_{i↑}n_{i↓}

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Quantum Coherence in Photosynthesis
VI. Quantum Physics.description: Quantum effects in biological energy transfer.

VI. Quantum Physics.name: Recent Breakthroughs (2024-2025)
discoveries: Abrupt quantum phase transitions in 3-atom-thin insulators
Quantum spin currents in graphene without magnetic fields
Cellular quantum computation via vibronic coupling
